Publications

Theses

Journal Papers

  1. Guillermo Polito, Stéphane Ducasse, Luc Fabresse and Noury Bouraqadi. Run-Fail-Grow: Producing Minimal and Specialized Runtimes. [[Submitted to Journal of Object Technology]]

Bootstrapping Reflective Systems: The Case of Pharo, Science of Computer Programming Journal on Science of Computer Programming, Volume 96, Part 1, Pages 1-174, 2014. Impact factor: 1.672 (SNIP 2014) - 0.796 (SJR 2014)

Conference Papers

  1. Guillermo Polito, Stéphane Ducasse, Noury Bouraqadi, Luc Fabresse. A Bootstrapping Infrastructure to Build and Extend Pharo-like Languages. [Accepted] Onward! 2015, Sun 25 - Fri 30 October 2015 Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, United States
  2. Guillermo Polito, Stéphane Ducasse, Noury Bouraqadi, Luc Fabresse, Max Mattone. Virtualization Support for Dynamic Core Library Update. [Accepted] Onward! 2015, Sun 25 - Fri 30 October 2015 Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, United States

Lecture nodes

Author and co-author of many lecture notes about software design, design patterns, logic, functional and object-oriented programming, and declarative programming. The lecture notes, in spanish, are on-line in the following sites:

  1. http://uqbar-wiki.org/
  2. http://www.pdep.com.ar
